name: As Above, So Below
fact: Filmed in the real catacombs beneath Paris, the filmmakers had to acquire special permission to shoot in the restricted areas.

name: The Autopsy of Jane Doe
fact: The role of the corpse, 'Jane Doe,' was played mostly by actress Olwen Kelly to make the autopsy scenes more realistic.

name: Drag Me to Hell
fact: Director Sam Raimi returned to his horror roots after making the Spider-Man trilogy with this film, full of his signature dark humor.

name: Evil Dead
fact: The infamous 'cabin in the woods' was an actual abandoned cabin that the filmmakers renovated just enough to shoot the movie.

name: Hereditary
fact: Hereditary is often considered one of the scariest films of all time due to its intense psychological horror and shocking moments.

name: Get Out
fact: Get Out became a cultural phenomenon, blending social commentary with horror and earning Jordan Peele an Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay.

name: The Conjuring
fact: The Conjuring is based on the real-life investigations of paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren, who claimed to have dealt with real hauntings.

name: A Quiet Place
fact: A Quiet Place features minimal dialogue, with the characters communicating primarily through sign language, creating a tense and immersive experience.

name: It Follows
fact: It Follows received acclaim for its unique premise, in which a supernatural entity relentlessly stalks its victims, creating a sense of paranoia.

name: The Babadook
fact: The Babadook is often interpreted as an allegory for grief and mental illness, utilizing horror elements to explore emotional struggles.
